ADD_CNAME_DESCRIPTION:
Important
When you enter a domain name in the next step, it will be available for use immediately. You must create the proper CNAME DNS record before adding the domain. Your system administrator knows how to do this. For more information, please use the documentation below depending on your domain registrar.

OUTGOING_ALLOWED_DESCRIPTION: Emails to these domains or email addresses will always be sent. Separate multiple values with enter. Allowed will override blocked.
INCOMING_ALLOWED_DESCRIPTION: Emails from these domains or email addresses will always be accepted. Separate multiple values with enter. Allowed will override blocked.
OUTGOING_BLOCKED_DESCRIPTION: Emails to these domains or email addresses will not be sent, regardless of channel. Separate multiple values with enter.
INCOMING_BLOCKED_DESCRIPTION: Emails from these domains or email addresses will be ignored, regardless of channel. Separate multiple values with enter.

SEND_MESSAGE_INFO: The "Send Message" node is useful when you want to tell the user something, but you don't need an answer.

PLAIN_EMAIL_DESCRIPTION: Show readers your emails are personal by creating an email with little formatting.
SIMPLE_EMAIL_DESCRIPTION: If you like to have minimal formatting, create an email with a simple template
WELCOME_EMAIL_DESCRIPTION: Create an email with this template to welcome new customers
CAMPAIGN_PLAIN_TEMPLATE:
Hi {{inputMessage.FIRST_NAME}},

Thanks so much for joining our mailing list. I hope you enjoy the content we provide throughout the year.

You can let us know if you have any questions or ideas by simply responding to this email. We’d love to hear from you.

Thanks,
Your full name
CAMPAIGN_SIMPLE_TEMPLATE:
Hello {{inputMessage.FIRST_NAME}},

Simple text emails have minimal formatting so your reader can really focus on what you have to say. Introduce yourself and explain why you’re reaching out.

Every email should try to lead the reader to some kind of action. Use this space to describe why the reader should want to click on the link below. Put the link on its own line to really draw their eye to it.

Link text

Now it’s time to wrap up your email. Before your signature, thank the recipient for reading. You can also invite them to send this email to any of their colleagues who might be interested.

All the best,
Your full name
Your job title
Other contact information
CAMPAIGN_WELCOME_TEMPLATE:
Hi {{inputMessage.FIRST_NAME}}, thank the reader for signing up to your newsletter and welcome them on board. Below your introduction, add a few links to some popular pages or posts on your website to give the reader an idea of what’s to come.
  1. Showcase your best stories
    Give an overview of an existing blog post or a popular story from a previous newsletter. Be sure to add a link so the reader can learn more.
  2. Help people get to know you
    Share a link to your website’s about us page where the reader can learn more about you and your community.
  3. Keep the conversation going
    Tell your reader how they can get in touch if they have questions.
Thanks,
The Your Company Name team

ADVANTAGES_1: 1. Scheduling the meeting at your convenience.
ADVANTAGES_2: 2. Automatically notify your customers once the meeting is scheduled.
ADVANTAGES_3: 3. Easy to set up, use and manage.
ADVANTAGES_5: 5. Connect via desktop clients, browsers, conference rooms & mobile devices.
ORDER_HINT: Order determines the execution order of workflows in this module, this field is auto populated with the next possible execution order.
TYPE_HINT: Type determines when the workflow gets triggered, on creation of entry/on update of entry or both.
DESCRIPTION_HINT: A Brief description of what workflow does.
STAGE_HINT: Stages are used to categorise the nodes in the workflow, stage has to be selected on all the nodes in the workflow in next step.
CONDITION_HINT: Conditions determine the execution of the workflow, if the conditions are true then the workflow executes.
START_ZOOM_HINT: Integrate zoom to enable this button,navigate to Company Settings > Integrations or contact system admin
INTEGRATION_STEPS_1: 1. Click on the Zoom button which is located under Integrations tab under Company Settings sidebar main menu.
INTEGRATION_STEPS_2: 2. Click on Add to Zoom on the upper right corner of the page. It will integrate the Zoom with your ngDesk subdomain and also take you to Zoom website to authorize.
INTEGRATION_STEPS_3: 3. Upon authorization, add Zoom data type into module and add it on to the Layout as a field.
INTEGRATION_STEPS_4: 4. Click on the button Create Zoom Meeting upon adding. This button will turn into Start Zoom Meeting label.
INTEGRATION_STEPS_5: 5. Click on the button Start Zoom Meeting to start the meeting.
ZOOM_INTEGRATION_MESSAGE: ngDesk is being installed in zoom, please wait...
ZOOM_INTEGRATION_FAILED: Installation of ngDesk on zoom failed, please try again
ARE_YOU_SURE_YOU_WANT_TO_DELETE_DASHBOAR: Are you sure you want to delete dashboard
SET_ANY_NORMALIZATION_RULE: Please set publisher or product or version
CHECK_DOCUMENTATION: check complete documentation on the support page
ARE_YOU_SURE_YOU_WANT_TO_DELETE_ENTERPRI: Are you sure you want to delete enterprise search
ARE_YOU_SURE_YOU_WANT_TO_DELETE_DISCOVER: Are you sure you want to delete discovery map
ARE_YOU_SURE_YOU_WANT_TO_DELETE_NORMALIZ: Are you sure you want to delete normalization rule
LIMIT: Limit data to number of rows
AWS_INTEGRATION_STEPS_1: 1. Click on the AWS Cloud Watch button which is located under Integrations tab under Company Settings sidebar main menu.
AWS_INTEGRATION_STEPS_2: 2. Copy the link mentioned in the page.
AWS_INTEGRATION_STEPS_3: 3. Login to your AWS Management Console and In search bar , type in Topic which is located at the top of the page and then click on Simple Notification Service .
AWS_INTEGRATION_STEPS_4: 4. Under Amazon SNS Dashboard, click on Topics and Hit on Create Topic .
AWS_INTEGRATION_STEPS_5: 5. Select Standard and then give it a name. Hit on Create Topic at the bottom of the page once done.Hit on Create a Subscription .
AWS_INTEGRATION_STEPS_6: 6. Under Topic ARN, select the one which ends with the name which you have provided as Topic name.Under Protocol, Select HTTPS .
AWS_INTEGRATION_STEPS_7: 7. Under Endpoint, paste the link which you have copied from AWS under your ngDesk account and then hit on Create Subscription at the bottom of the page for the changes to take effect.
AWS_INTEGRATION_STEPS_8: 8. Go to Services and then Select CloudWatch under Management & Governance .
AWS_INTEGRATION_STEPS_9: 9. Click on Alarms from the Left side menu and then click on Create Alarm .
AWS_INTEGRATION_STEPS_10: 10. Click on Select Metric and then select the metric which belongs to you from All metrics .
AWS_INTEGRATION_STEPS_11: 11. Select the conditions according to your requirements and then click on Next .
AWS_INTEGRATION_STEPS_12: 12. Create 2 different alarms - one for In Alarm and another one for Ok Alarm. These 2 are mandatory without which the tickets will not be created.
